headline: Everest Group swung to quarterly loss on one-time charge tied to loss reserves
summary: The company last week disclosed that its fourth-quarter and full-year 2024 earnings will include a one-time charge of $1.5 billion tied to prior year's loss reserves and a further $229 million of current accident year strengthening.  A loss reserve refers to an insurer's projected liability for future claim payouts.  Bermuda-based Everest offers property, casualty and specialty reinsurance and insurance services, and operates in more than 100 countries across six continents.

headline: Everest Reports Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2024 Results
summary: HAMILTON, Bermuda, February 03, 2025--Everest Group, Ltd. (NYSE: EG), a global underwriting leader providing best-in-class property, casualty, and specialty reinsurance and insurance solutions, today reported its fourth quarter 2024 results.
